byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein reported from Lashkar Gah, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and TAIMOOR SHAH

abstract: Taliban appears to be softening their stance in many areas of Afghanistan, yet their harsh policies of 1990s are still enforced in Baghran, Afghanistan; contrast in behavior leads many to question if new approach is only charm offensive and group still desires hard-line rule.
lead_paragraph: In the Baghran district of Helmand Province, where the Taliban were scarcely ever out of power, the harsh policies of the ’90s are still in full swing.

headline.main: Taliban Present Gentler Face but Wield Iron Fist in Afghan District
headline.print_headline: Hard-Line Rule by Taliban Belies Charm Offensive
